subject: Learning
title: Hindsight Bias in Learning
description: One-minute skill: Hindsight Bias in Learning.

hook.text: After seeing the answer, you think 'I knew that!' You didn'tâ€”but hindsight rewrites your memory.

buildup.text: Hindsight bias makes past events seem predictable after you know the outcome.

discovery.text: In learning, it prevents accurate self-assessment: you think you knew the material because the answer looks obvious now.

twist.text: This leads to under-studying. Why review what you 'already knew'? Except you didn't know it before.

climax.text: Cover the answers. Test yourself first. Only then judge what you actually know.

punchline.text: Hindsight makes everything obvious. Don't let it fool your study plan.

quiz.question: How does hindsight bias affect studying?
options: It makes students think they already knew the answer, leading to under-studying
It motivates students to study more
It only affects memory for historical events
